ARABIC: وَإِن جَٰدَلُوكَ فَقُلِ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If they do argue with you, say: 'Allah knows best what you are doing.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If they argue with you, tell them: "God knows well what you are doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And if they dispute with you, say: "Allah knows well what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: If they still dispute with you about your worship, tell them, "God knows best what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And if they quarrel with you, say, “Allah well knows your evil deeds.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And if they argue with you, say: "Allah knows best of what you do."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if they contend with you, say: Allah best knows what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And if they should dispute with thee, do thou say, 'God knows very well what you are doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if they wrangle with thee, say: Allah is Best Aware of what ye do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: if they should dispute with you, then say, "God is well aware of what you do."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And if they dispute with thee, say thou: Allah knoweth best that which ye Work.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But if they dispute with you, say, ‘Allah knows best what you are doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: If they do wrangle with thee, say, "Allah knows best what it is ye are doing."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And if they argue with you (as regards the slaughtering of the sacrifices), say; "Allah knows best of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: If they argue with you, say: 'Allah knows best all that you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But if they dispute with you, say, “God is fully aware of what you do.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if they dispute with you, then say, "Allah is most knowing of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [22:68] And if they dispute with you, in the matter of religion, say, ‘God knows best what you do, and will requite you for it — this was [revealed] before the command to fight [them].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if they wrangle with thee) concerning sacrifices and Allah's divine Oneness, because of their saying: "that which Allah immolates is more lawful than what you immolate with your own knives", (say: Allah is best aware of what ye do) in the practice of your religion, whether it is a question of sacrifices or other things.
